intro: Diplocyclos tenuis, commonly known as the narrowleaf diplocyclos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, round fruits. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
